title: Dinesh Rawal
text:
Dinesh Rawal


Civil Engineer · MBA Student





About Me


I am a passionate Civil Engineer who believes in discipline and consistency theory for a growth career. I have skills in AutoCAD, structural analysis, cost estimation, project management, structural design, site supervision and practical experience in infrastructure development and design. I am pursuing MBA at UCW to improve my skills in business courses like leadership, project management, Marketing and Application of AI in Business. My career goal is to lead big Projects from the front in the construction field.




Professional Experience


Civil Engineer – New Planet Engineering Consultancy, Kathmandu



I still feel so proud to give the final design of Kumar Balaram Memorial Hostel. I used AutoCAD and Civil 3D to complete the project.



Site Engineer – Okhaldhunga Ring Road, DPR and Design



Worked for 3 months as a surveyor in the site and completed 48 km survey. After that I started working on data and designing using SW Road software. I gave my best till the end of the project.





Education



Master of Business Administration (MBA) — University Canada West


Bachelor of Civil Engineering — Tribhuvan University, Nepal





Key Skills & Strengths




AutoCAD


Cost Estimation


Structural Analysis


Project Management


Site Supervision


SW DTM Software


Microsoft Word & Excel






Contact


Email: dineshrawal2057@gmail.com


LinkedIn: linkedin.com/in/dineshrawal


Location: 13350 Central Avenue, Surrey, BC

title: Projects
text:
I have mentioned three projects below which i have performed and completed during college and after joining engineering consultancy.





MTMP Implementation Geospatial Infrastructure Assessment


Duration: 15 days


Role: Worked as a Surveyor using tools like GPS, Total Station to gather data and map the road conditions, drainage systems, accessibility problems, and public infrastructure


Outcome: Able to provide correct data that would be used in transport planning and future road improvements


Experience: Field survey experience and work with the municipal engineers, local leaders and local peoples


Learnings: Better skills in data collection, surveying tools and MTMP planning process




Okhaldhunga Ring Road, DPR and Design


Duration: 3 months


Role: Worked as a Site Engineer and Surveyor using GPS, Total Station, SW Road Software, AutoCAD etc. and completed 48km road alignment and aided road design according to Nepal DPR requirements


Deleiverable: Survey and design information completed in consultancy to be submitted to the municipal to be approved and constructed in future


Experience: Experience of DPR process and coordination with engineers, co-workers and local people


Learnings: Improved surveying skills, road design and project documentation skills




Concept Of One Rupee


Performance: Worked as a founder president of a social volunteering and fundraising program for deprived people as a concept of maximization of money, which means a small penny can impact someone’s life by donating a small amount. It is a social project done under the subject of economics and microproject management, which was started under my leadership with a team of 500 people with a core group of 50 people who form, manage, and plan a project that will impact people’s lives through a popular program like Feed for Hunger Nepal, Education for All, Youth for Development, and so on.
